formattedAddress: 95 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 95 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual restaurant serving 40+ kinds of empanadas in a narrow, colorful dining room until late night.

originalText.text:
We were sat at a decent time. Me and my friend order brunch items. I ordered steak and eggs and he ordered pancakes. My dish came and his didn’t. After 30 minutes his pancakes still never came as my food was getting cold sitting in front of me waiting for his. It was hard to get our servers attention. So I had to get up and find her to find out the kitchen skipped his order. I found the server printing out a receipt of our food to go back to kitchen with it. They looked at the ticket like they never received it. We then waited another 15 minutes with still no food. After trying to get the servers attention again we asked her for a to go box for my food and drinks to go and the bill b/c we were just over it at this point….. she couldn’t even bring us that. Again, we got up to find her. Again, they brought out just one drink and had to wait about 10 minutes for the next one. When making orders why do it partially? I never got my to go box so I had to leave my food. The server decided to only charge us for the 2 drinks & as we were leaving the pancakes finally came out and we just took them to go.

Lastly I wanted to add that there should be NO REASON a baby is at the bar! I brought it to security’s attention and I don’t think he understood English and I brought it to our servers attention & she said “oh that’s not my baby” like girl I know that … The baby should not be at the bar!

Poor service very disappointed . The steak I had was wayyy too chewy …

originalText.text: I ordered the bandeja paisa. The taste was nice, you could taste that all the ingredients were fresh. The employees in the restaurant were nice and friendly. The price of the bandeja paisa was around 30 USD dollars. It's not cheap, but for New York it's pretty good.

text.text: I ordered the bandeja paisa. The taste was nice, you could taste that all the ingredients were fresh. The employees in the restaurant were nice and friendly. The price of the bandeja paisa was around 30 USD dollars. It's not cheap, but for New York it's pretty good.

originalText.text: my boyfriend and i have been trying chicharron from many places before but this is by far not the best. We were in the area and wanted to try this places chicharron, as expected the reviews are amazing the places looks vibrant but the food not so much. Now of course i’m not saying all the food here was bad as we only got the chicharron and guacamole but the pork was mostly just fat and it was disgusting, we ate the two that had the most meat on it but the fat was too much my boyfriend almost threw up. The guac on the other hand was amazing.

text.text: my boyfriend and i have been trying chicharron from many places before but this is by far not the best. We were in the area and wanted to try this places chicharron, as expected the reviews are amazing the places looks vibrant but the food not so much. Now of course i’m not saying all the food here was bad as we only got the chicharron and guacamole but the pork was mostly just fat and it was disgusting, we ate the two that had the most meat on it but the fat was too much my boyfriend almost threw up. The guac on the other hand was amazing.

originalText.text: One of the best empanadas I've ever eaten, a variety of filling and dough options, the corn dough is AMAZING, everyone should try it, I just think there should be more filling options for this dough.

text.text: One of the best empanadas I've ever eaten, a variety of filling and dough options, the corn dough is AMAZING, everyone should try it, I just think there should be more filling options for this dough.

originalText.text: The food is incredible but the wait time is very long. Takes about 15-20 minutes to make even just one empanada. The front desk ignores you for several minutes when you first arrive anyway so you usually have to try to get their attention, even then they may ask you to wait. That's before you even order. It's happened like 80% of the times I've gone. Also, I don't recommend ordering delivery because I've had issues every time, so now I just pick up. Most recently, I specifically asked for it to be left at the receptionist desk of my job since I would be working. Instead they called me when they arrived (but I was working so couldn't pick up) and then just brought the order back to their store. Not the worst thing in the world but just defeats the entire purpose of delivery. I've had this happen a few times. My job has a huge sign out front and the entire storefront is a window, very very easy to spot. Other than the service though, the food is great.
